name: IpMa57TSolverInterface
brief:
Interface to HSL MA57 sparse symmetric indefinite solver

Ma57TSolverInterface wraps the Harwell MA57 subroutine, an improved
multifrontal solver over MA27 with better memory management and
numerical stability.

algorithms.name:
Improved Multifrontal LDL^T with Advanced Pivoting:
  MA57 computes A = P·L·D·L^T·P^T using an improved multifrontal
  method with better pivot handling than MA27:
  - Static pivoting: pre-determined pivots from symbolic phase
  - Dynamic pivoting: adjustment during numerical factorization
  - 2×2 pivots for indefinite blocks with Bunch-Kaufman strategy
algorithms.math:
Stability improvements over MA27:
  - Lookahead pivoting: examines future columns for better pivots
  - Delayed pivots: postpones problematic pivots to later stages
  - Pivot perturbation: adds ε to tiny pivots instead of failing
  Solve modes: Ax=b, PLPTx=b, PDPTx=b, PLTPT x=b
algorithms.complexity:
Same asymptotic as MA27: O(n·f²) factorization, O(nnz(L)) solve.
  Typically 2-3× faster than MA27 due to better memory access patterns
  and BLAS-3 dense operations within frontal matrices.
ref:
Duff (2004). "MA57 - A Code for the Solution of Sparse Symmetric
     Definite and Indefinite Systems". ACM TOMS 30(2):118-144.

MA57 improvements over MA27:
- Better pivot selection for numerical stability
- More efficient memory management
- Support for multiple right-hand sides
- Better handling of dense row detection

Input format: Triplet (lower triangular), same as MA27

Phases (MA57A/B/C/E/I):
- MA57I: Initialize control parameters
- MA57A: Symbolic factorization
- MA57B: Numerical factorization
- MA57C: Solve (job selects A, PLP^T, PDP^T, or PL^T P^T)
- MA57E: Copy/resize factor arrays

Key parameters:
- pivtol_/pivtolmax_: Threshold pivoting tolerance
- ma57_pre_alloc_: Factor for initial workspace allocation
